metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Layout - Float Examples
This page contains common float examples.
content.html: This page contains common float examples.

content.text: With the float property, it is easy to float boxes of content side by side:
content.html: With the float property, it is easy to float boxes of content side by side:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
float: left;  width: 33.33%; /* three 
  boxes (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */  padding: 
  50px; /* if you want space between the images */

/* three 
  boxes (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */
/* if you want space between the images */

syntax_highlighting.text:
float: left;  width: 33.33%; /* three 
  boxes (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */  padding: 
  50px; /* if you want space between the images */

/* three 
  boxes (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */
/* if you want space between the images */

content.code_html:
* {
  box-sizing: border-box;
}

.box {
  float: left;
  width: 33.33%; /* three boxes (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */
  padding: 50px; /* if you want space between the images */
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
float: left;  width: 33.33%; /* three 
  boxes (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */  padding: 
  50px; /* if you want space between the images */

/* three 
  boxes (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */
/* if you want space between the images */

content.text: What is box-sizing?
content.html: What is box-sizing?

content.text: You can easily create three floating boxes side by side. However, when you add something that enlarges the width of each box (e.g. padding or borders), the box will break. The box-sizing property allows us to include the padding and border in the box's total width (and height), making sure that the padding stays inside of the box and that it does not break.
content.html: You can easily create three floating boxes side by side. However, when you add something that enlarges the width of each box (e.g. padding or borders), the box will break. The box-sizing property allows us to include the padding and border in the box's total width (and height), making sure that the padding stays inside of the box and that it does not break.

content.text: You can read more about the box-sizing property in our CSS Box Sizing Chapter .
content.html: You can read more about the box-sizing property in our CSS Box Sizing Chapter.

content.text: Images Side By Side
The grid of boxes can also be used to display images side by side:
content.html: The grid of boxes can also be used to display images side by side:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
float: left;  width: 33.33%; /* three 
  containers (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */  padding: 
  5px; /* if you want space between the images */

/* three 
  containers (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */
/* if you want space between the images */

syntax_highlighting.text:
float: left;  width: 33.33%; /* three 
  containers (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */  padding: 
  5px; /* if you want space between the images */

/* three 
  containers (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */
/* if you want space between the images */

content.code_html:
.img-container {
  float: left;
  width: 33.33%; /* three containers (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */
  padding: 5px; /* if you want space between the images */
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
float: left;  width: 33.33%; /* three 
  containers (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */  padding: 
  5px; /* if you want space between the images */

/* three 
  containers (use 25% for four, and 50% for two, etc) */
/* if you want space between the images */

content.text: Equal Height Boxes

In the previous example, you learned how to float boxes side by side with an equal width. However, it is not easy to create floating boxes with equal heights. A quick fix however, is to set a fixed height, like in the example below:
content.html: In the previous example, you learned how to float boxes side by side with an equal width. However, it is not easy to create floating boxes with equal heights. A quick fix however, is to set a fixed height, like in the example below:

content.text: Box 1
Some content, some content, some content
content.html: Some content, some content, some content

content.text: Box 2
Some content, some content, some content
content.html: Some content, some content, some content

content.text: Some content, some content, some content
content.html: Some content, some content, some content

content.text: Some content, some content, some content
content.html: Some content, some content, some content

content.code_html:
.box {
  height: 500px;
}

content.text: However , this is not very flexible. It is ok if you can guarantee that the boxes will always have the same amount of content in them. But many times, the content is not the same. If you try the example above on a mobile phone, you will see that the second box's content will be displayed outside of the box. This is where CSS3 Flexbox comes in handy - as it can automatically stretch boxes to be as long as the longest box:
content.html: However, this is not very flexible. It is ok if you can guarantee that the boxes will always have the same amount of content in them. But many times, the content is not the same. If you try the example above on a mobile phone, you will see that the second box's content will be displayed outside of the box. This is where CSS3 Flexbox comes in handy - as it can automatically stretch boxes to be as long as the longest box:

content.code: Example Using Flexbox to create flexible boxes: Box 1 - This is some text to make sure that the content gets really tall. This is some text to make sure that the content gets really tall. This is some text to make sure that the content gets really tall. Box 2 - My height will follow Box 1. Try it Yourself »

content.text: Tip: You can read more about the Flexbox Layout Module in our CSS Flexbox Chapter .
content.html: Tip:  You can read more about the Flexbox Layout Module in our CSS Flexbox Chapter.

content.text: Navigation Menu
You can also use float with a list of hyperlinks to create a horizontal menu:
content.html: You can also use float with a list of hyperlinks to create a horizontal menu:

content.code: Example Home News Contact About Try it Yourself »

content.text: Web Layout Example
It is also common to do entire web layouts using the float property:
content.html: It is also common to do entire web layouts using the float property:

content.code_html:
.header, .footer {
  background-color: grey;
  color: white;
  padding: 15px;
}

.column {
  float: left;
  padding: 15px;
}

.clearfix::after {
  content: "";
  clear: both;
  display: table;
}

.menu {
  width: 25%;
}

.content {
  width: 75%;
}

content.text: Creating a website with float Use float to create a homepage with a navbar, header, footer, left content and main content.
content.html:
Creating a website with float
Use float to create a homepage with a navbar, header, footer, left content and main content.

content.text: All CSS Float Properties

content.code_html:
Property Description
box-sizing Defines how the width and height of an element are calculated: should they include padding and borders, or not
clear Specifies what should happen with the element that is next to a floating element
float Specifies whether an element should float to the left, right, or not at all
overflow Specifies what happens if content overflows an element's box
overflow-x Specifies what to do with the left/right edges of the content if it overflows the element's content area
overflow-y Specifies what to do with the top/bottom edges of the content if it overflows the element's content area
